titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ida Elizabeth Kopp Student Notebook MC.273
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 14:38:02 -0500.

did.abstract: Ida Elizabeth Kopp was a night student at New York University's School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance (later known as the Leonard N. Stern School of Business) from approximately 1926 through 1932. She was the only daughter of an immigrant couple from Germany and Switzerland. She graduated with a Bachelor's degree and later worked as a secretary to the President of Stauffer Chemical Company located in the Graybar Building of Grand Central Station. This collection consists of Kopp's student notebook from her classes at NYU from roughly 1927 through 1932.

container.altrender: Custom Drop Spine Box (2" height, any dimensions up to 8" x 20")
container.label: Mixed Materials [31142046558337]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of Ida Elizabeth Kopp's student notebook from her classes at the New York University School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance from roughly 1927 through 1932.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ida Elizabeth Kopp was a night student at New York University's School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance (later known as the Leonard N. Stern School of Business) from approximately 1926 through 1932. She was the only daughter of an immigrant couple from Germany and Switzerland. She graduated with a Bachelor's degree and later worked as a secretary to the President of Stauffer Chemical Company located in the Graybar Building of Grand Central Station.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of one item and has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the creator are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from New York University Archives, (212) 998-2646, university-archives@nyu.edu.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Barbara C. Sampson, Kopp's daughter, in March 2017. The accession number associated with this gift is 2017.010.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Ida Elizabeth Kopp Student Notebook; MC 273; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, the item was described at the collection- and item-level. The item underwent basic mold treatment and was rehoused in October 2017.
